verses.text: And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake unto Moses , saying ,

Speak unto Aaron and to his sons , that they separate themselves from the holy things of the children of Israel , and that they profane not my holy name \add in those things\add* which they hallow unto me: I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

Say unto them, Whosoever \add he be\add* of all your seed among your generations , that goeth unto the holy things , which the children of Israel hallow unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, having his uncleanness upon him, that soul shall be cut off from my presence : I \add am\add* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.

What man soever of the seed of Aaron \add is\add* a leper , or hath a running issue ; he shall not eat of the holy things , until he be clean. And whoso toucheth any thing \add that is\add* unclean \add by\add* the dead , or a man whose seed goeth from him;\f + \fr 22.4 \ft running…: Heb. running of the reins\f*
Or whosoever toucheth any creeping thing , whereby he may be made unclean , or a man of whom he may take uncleanness , whatsoever uncleanness he hath;
The soul which hath touched any such shall be unclean until even , and shall not eat of the holy things , unless he wash his flesh with water.
And when the sun is down , he shall be clean , and shall afterward eat of the holy things ; because it \add is\add* his food.
That which dieth of itself , or is torn \add with beasts\add*, he shall not eat to defile himself therewith: I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
They shall therefore keep mine ordinance , lest they bear sin for it, and die therefore, if they profane it: I the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* do sanctify them. \p
There shall no stranger eat \add of\add* the holy thing : a sojourner of the priest , or an hired servant , shall not eat \add of\add* the holy thing.

But if the priest buy \add any\add* soul with his money , he shall eat of it, and he that is born in his house : they shall eat of his meat.\f + \fr 22.11 \ft with…: Heb. with the purchase of his money\f*
If the priest’s daughter also be \add married\add* unto a stranger , she may not eat of an offering of the holy things.\f + \fr 22.12 \ft a stranger: Heb. a man a stranger\f*

But if the priest’s daughter be a widow , or divorced , and have no child , and is returned unto her father’s house , as in her youth , she shall eat of her father’s meat : but there shall no stranger eat thereof. \p
¶ And if a man eat \add of\add* the holy thing unwittingly , then he shall put the fifth \add part\add* thereof unto it, and shall give \add it\add* unto the priest with the holy thing.
And they shall not profane the holy things of the children of Israel , which they offer unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*;

Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass , when they eat their holy things : for I the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* do sanctify them.\f + \fr 22.16 \ft suffer…: or, lade themselves with the iniquity of trespass in their eating\f* \p
¶ And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake unto Moses , saying ,

Speak unto Aaron , and to his sons , and unto all the children of Israel , and say unto them, Whatsoever \add he be\add* of the house of Israel , or of the strangers in Israel , that will offer his oblation for all his vows , and for all his freewill offerings , which they will offer unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* for a burnt offering ;
\add Ye shall offer\add* at your own will a male without blemish , of the beeves , of the sheep , or of the goats.
\add But\add* whatsoever hath a blemish , \add that\add* shall ye not offer : for it shall not be acceptable for you.

And whosoever offereth a sacrifice of peace offerings unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* to accomplish \add his\add* vow , or a freewill offering in beeves or sheep , it shall be perfect to be accepted ; there shall be no blemish therein.\f + \fr 22.21 \ft sheep: or, goats\f*

Blind , or broken , or maimed , or having a wen , or scurvy , or scabbed , ye shall not offer these unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, nor make an offering by fire of them upon the altar unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.

Either a bullock or a lamb that hath any thing superfluous or lacking in his parts , that mayest thou offer \add for\add* a freewill offering ; but for a vow it shall not be accepted.\f + \fr 22.23 \ft lamb: or, kid\f*
Ye shall not offer unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* that which is bruised , or crushed , or broken , or cut ; neither shall ye make \add any offering thereof\add* in your land.

Neither from a stranger’s hand shall ye offer the bread of your God of any of these; because their corruption \add is\add* in them, \add and\add* blemishes \add be\add* in them: they shall not be accepted for you. \p
¶ And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake unto Moses , saying ,

When a bullock , or a sheep , or a goat , is brought forth , then it shall be seven days under the dam ; and from the eighth day and thenceforth it shall be accepted for an offering made by fire unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
And \add whether it be\add* cow or ewe , ye shall not kill it and her young both in one day.\f + \fr 22.28 \ft ewe: or, she goat\f*
And when ye will offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, offer \add it\add* at your own will.
On the same day it shall be eaten up ; ye shall leave none of it until the morrow : I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
Therefore shall ye keep my commandments , and do them: I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
Neither shall ye profane my holy name ; but I will be hallowed among the children of Israel : I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* which hallow you,
That brought you out of the land of Egypt , to be your God : I \add am\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
